thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Wednesday, 31 Jan 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Poland - Factors to Watch Jan 31

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Poland - Factors to Watch Jan 31
text:
Following are news stories, press reports and events to watch that may affect Poland’s financial markets on Wednesday. ALL TIMES GMT (Poland: GMT + 1 hour):
BZ WBK Polish lender Bank Zachodni WBK reported a 19 percent jump in fourth-quarter net profit on Wednesday, underpinned by improvements in its core segments’ results on the back of an accelerating economy.
KACZYNSKI There are so many areas in Poland that have to be changed radically that the ruling Law and Justice (PiS) will need at least three terms to do it, the party leader told Gazeta Polska weekly in an interview published on Wednesday.
DANWOOD Private equity fund Enterprise Investors plans to list its Polish energy-efficient housebuilder Danwood on the Warsaw Stock Exchange, Puls Biznesu daily said quoting the company’s statement.
CD PROJEKT, ASSECO POLAND Poland’s largest video game developer CD Projekt will likely replace Asseco Poland, the country’s largest IT company, in the Warsaw Stock Exchange blue chip index WIG20 in the next revision in March, Puls Biznesu daily said quoting analysts.
BMW German BMW had planned to invest in the electric vehicles business in Poland, but resigned after Warsaw launched regulations which hit wind farms, Dziennik Gazeta Prawna daily said quoting unnamed sources.
SUNDAY TRADE Poland’s president signed into law a Sunday trade bill which restricts trading to two Sundays in a month, Parkiet daily said.
****Reuters has not verified stories reported by Polish media and does not vouch for their accuracy.****
